content:
# Security Policy

## Supported Versions

| Version | Supported          |
| ------- | ------------------ |
| 6.8.x   | :white_check_mark: |

## Reporting a Vulnerability

If you think that you have found a security issue in Pimcore, 
donâ€™t use the bug tracker and donâ€™t publish it publicly. 
Instead, all security issues must be reported via [this form](https://pimcorehq.wufoo.com/forms/pimcore-security-report/).


## Resolving Process
Every submitted security issue is handled with top priority by the core-team by following these steps: 

1. Confirm the vulnerability
2. Determine the severity
3. Contact reporter
4. Work on a patch
5. Get a CVE identification number (may be done by the reporter or a security service provider)
6. Patch reviewing 
7. Tagging a new release for supported versions
8. Publish security announcement

content:
# Security Policy

## Reporting a Vulnerability

If you think that you have found a security issue, 
donâ€™t use the bug tracker and donâ€™t publish it publicly. 
Instead, all security issues must be reported via ðŸ“« to [security-issue@pimcore.com](mailto:security-issue@pimcore.com).
Additionally, we also check issues reported via [huntr.dev](https://huntr.dev/repos/pimcore/pimcore/).


## Resolving Process
Every submitted security issue is handled with top priority by following these steps: 

1. Confirm the vulnerability
2. Determine the severity
3. Contact reporter
4. Work on a patch
5. Get a CVE identification number (may be done by the reporter or a security service provider)
6. Patch reviewing 
7. Tagging a new release for supported versions
8. Publish security announcement
